int rlexec ( const char *  command  )  

  call execvp(arg[0],arg) on unix

Definition at line 92 of file rlcutil.cpp.

00093 {
00094   char *buf;
00095   char *arg[512];
00096   int i,iarg,ret;
00097 
00098   buf = new char [strlen(command)+1];
00099   strcpy(buf,command);
00100   iarg = 0;
00101   i = 0;
00102   while(buf[i] != '\0')
00103   {
00104     if(buf[i] == '\"')
00105     {
00106       i++;
00107       arg[iarg++] = &buf[i];
00108       while(buf[i] != '\"' && buf[i] != '\0') i++;
00109       if(buf[i] == '\0') break;
00110       buf[i] = '\0';
00111     }
00112     else if(buf[i] != ' ' || i == 0)
00113     {
00114       arg[iarg++] = &buf[i];
00115       while(buf[i] != ' ' && buf[i] != '\0') i++;
00116       if(buf[i] == '\0') break;
00117       buf[i] = '\0';
00118     }
00119     i++;
00120   }
00121   arg[iarg] = NULL;
00122 
00123   ret = execvp(arg[0],arg);
00124   delete [] buf;
00125   return ret;
00126 }
